info.description: All times are UTC. Rate limiting can vary by endpoint.
info.title: Pure Access API v2

get.description: Returns all access points for the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

parameters.name: macAddress
parameters.description: Filter result set by specific MAC address.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter result set by specific access point name.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Filter result set by device type.

get.description: Returns information about the specified access point.

put.description:
A method used to update all devices with the most current data configured in Pure Access. This method works identically to the "update access points" button in Pure Access, compiling all user, credential, and schedule information and sending it down to all devices connected to the tenant (essentially syncs the data in Pure Access with the local database on the devices.) Since this operation is resource intensive, a rolling rate limit of `four requests per hour` is enforced. This not only safeguards against bursts of traffic to maximize the stability of the system, but also helps protect the flash memory of the devices from excessive read/write cycles.

Given the relatively low rate limit enforced on this endpoint, it is recommended that you first process all of the changes needed for the system, then send the compile request to update all devices only if needed.

202.description: Sends a compile to update the local database on all access points currently connected to the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

get.description: A method to retrieve the state of an access point specified by the access point id. The state of an access point contains data such as door sense status (Closed, Open, Unknown), lock status (Locked, Unlocked, Scheduled), state (Normal, Unlocked, LockedDown, Offline), etc.

put.description:
A method that allows you to manipulate the current "state" or access mode of the access point. This will override the current state of the reader in Pure Access. There are 4 different states available in this method -

**Unlock** - Unlocks the specified access point(s). The access point state will reset to its normal schedule at midnight.

**Lockdown** - Locks down the specified access point(s). Access points moved to a lockdown state will remain lockdown until the access point is moved to another state. Locked down access points will ignore any unlock schedules and will decline all badges except for master badges.

**Schedule** - Returns an access point to its schedule based on the current day and time as specified in Pure Access.

**Admit** - Unlocks a door for the "latch interval" configured for the specified access point.

get.description: Returns all access point groups for the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

post.description: Adds a new access point group.

put.description: Overwrites parameters for one or multiple access point groups. This method requires you to specify all of the editable parameters related to the access point groups you are editing. If an editable field is left out of a PUT request it will be nulled out.

patch.description: Updates specified fields for one or multiple access point groups. Parameters not included in the PATCH request will not be modified.

put.description:
A method that allows you to manipulate the current "state" or access mode of all of the access points in an access point group. This will override the current state of the reader in Pure Access. There are 4 different states available in this method -
**Unlock** - Unlocks the specified access point(s) in the access point group. The access point state will reset to its normal schedule at midnight.
**Lockdown** - Locks down the specified access point(s) in the access point group. Access points moved to a lockdown state will remain lockdown until the access point is moved to another state. Locked down access points will ignore any unlock schedules and will decline all badges except for master badges.
**Schedule** - Returns access point(s) in the access point group to their schedule(s) based on the current day and time as specified in Pure Access.
**Admit** - Unlocks access point(s) in the access point group for the "latch interval" configured for each access point.

get.description: Returns information about a specific access point group.

delete.description: Deletes a specific access point group.

204.description: Success, no content needed in response

get.description: Returns all access points within a specific access point group.

put.description: Overwrites the list of access points included in the specified access point group. After a PUT to this endpoint, the access point group will only contain the access points IDs included in this request.

post.description: This method will **add** the specified access points to the access point group. For example, if the access point group contains access point IDs 1, 2, and 3 and your POST request contains access point IDs 4 and 5, the access point group will contain access point IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 after the POST request.

delete.description: This method will **delete** the specified access points from the access point group. For example, if the access point group contains access point IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 and your DELETE request contains access point IDs 4 and 5, the access point group will contain access point IDs 1, 2, and 3, after the DELETE request.

parameters.name: accessPointIds
parameters.description: The list of access point IDs to delete.

schema.description: An array of access point IDs for the specified resource.

204.description: Success, no content needed in response

get.description: Returns all user groups for the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

put.description: Overwrites parameters for one or multiple user groups. This method requires you to specify all of the editable parameters related to the user groups you are editing. If an editable field is left out of a PUT request it will be nulled out.

patch.description: Updates a user group. Parameters not included in the PATCH request will not be modified.

get.description: Returns all users for the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Searches all users on firstName, lastName, credentials, userDefininedFields, and username.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: maximum number of records to return, the max limit is 50 records if images are included via the "includeImages" parameter or 500 if images are not included.

post.description: Adds new user(s) to the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

put.description: Overwrites parameters for one or multiple users. This method requires you to specify all of the editable parameters related to the users you are editing. If an editable field is left out of a PUT request it will be nulled out.

patch.description: Updates specified fields for one or multiple users. Parameters not included in the PATCH request will not be modified.

get.description: Returns all of the configured user defined fields that can be sent when creating a user.
Returns information about a specific user group.

204.description: Success, no content needed in response.

get.description: Returns all users within a specific user group.

put.description: Overwrites the list of users included in the specified user group. After a PUT to this endpoint, the user group will only contain the user IDs included in this request.

post.description: This method will **add** the specified users to the user group. For example, if the user group contains IDs 1, 2, and 3 and your POST request contains user IDs 4 and 5, the user group will contain user IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 after the POST request.

delete.description: This method will **delete** the specified users from the user group. For example, if the user group contains access point IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 and your DELETE request contains user IDs 4 and 5, the user group will contain user IDs 1, 2, and 3, after the DELETE request.

parameters.name: userIds
parameters.description: The list of user IDs to delete from the user group.

204.description: Success, no content needed in response

get.description: Returns all credentials for the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

post.description: Add credential(s) for the user IDs specified in the request.

patch.description: Updates credential(s) for the user IDs specified in the request. If the correct bitmask is set on the tenant, you do not need to specify a raw value for the credential.

get.description: Returns information about the specified credential ID.
Returns information about the specified user ID.
Returns all of the user groups that the specified user ID belongs to.

put.description: Overwrites the list of user groups that the specified user ID belongs to. After a PUT to this endpoint, the user will only be a member of the user groups included in this request.

post.description: This method will **add** the specified user ID to the user groups specified in the request. For example, if a user belongs to user group IDs 1, 2, and 3 and your POST request contains user group IDs 4 and 5, the user will belong to user group IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 after the POST request.

delete.description: This method will **delete** the specified user ID to the user groups specified in the request. For example, if a user belongs to user group IDs 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 and your DELETE request contains user group IDs 4 and 5, the user will belong to user group IDs 1, 2, and 3 after the DELETE request.

204.description: Success, no content needed in response

get.description: Returns event history for the Pure Access tenant associated with the API token.

accessPointIdPathParam.name: accessPointId
accessPointIdPathParam.description: The unique identifier for the access point.

setStatePathParam.name: setState
setStatePathParam.description:
Set State:
 * `admit` Perform an admit against the specified access point.
 * `lockdown` Set the specified access point to lockdown.
 * `schedule` Set the specified access point to schedule.
 * `unlock` Set the specified access point to unlocked.

accessPointGroupIdPathParam.name: accessPointGroupId
accessPointGroupIdPathParam.description: The unique identifier for the access point group.

credentialIdPathParam.name: credentialId
credentialIdPathParam.description: The unique identifier for the credential.

userIdPathParam.name: userId
userIdPathParam.description: The unique identifier for the user.

userGroupIdPathParam.name: userGroupId
userGroupIdPathParam.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

accessPointIdsParam.name: accessPointIds
accessPointIdsParam.description: An array of access point IDs.

accessPointGroupIdsParam.name: accessPointGroupIds
accessPointGroupIdsParam.description: An array of access point group IDs.

credentialDisplayValuesParam.name: credentialDisplayValues
credentialDisplayValuesParam.description: An array of credential display values.

credentialTypeParam.name: credentialType
credentialTypeParam.description: Filter result set by credential type.

searchParam.name: search
searchParam.description: The value specified here searches on the displayValue of the credential. See model ``Credential`` for definition of displayValue. Whatever value is specified in the search parameter will return credentials that displayValue's match the searches value.

userIdParam.name: userId
userIdParam.description: The unique identifier for the user.

accessPointGroupIdParam.name: accessPointGroupId
accessPointGroupIdParam.description: The unique identifier for the access point group.

userGroupIdParam.name: userGroupId
userGroupIdParam.description: The unique identifier for the user group.

userGroupIdsParam.name: userGroupIds
userGroupIdsParam.description: An array of user group IDs.

areaIdParam.name: areaId
areaIdParam.description: The primary area associated with the record.

includeDisabledParam.name: includeDisabled
includeDisabledParam.description: If true, the request will return records that are both active and inactive.

includeImagesParam.name: includeImages
includeImagesParam.description: If true, the record(s) are returned with images if they are present. Request will only return a maximum of 50 records if true. Requests will return 500 records if false.

createdStartDateTimeParam.name: createdStartDateTime
createdStartDateTimeParam.description: The specified start date time when looking up records by created date time. If no end date time is specified all records equal to or after the start date time will be returned.

createdEndDateTimeParam.name: createdEndDateTime
createdEndDateTimeParam.description: The specified end date time used when looking up records by updated date time. If no start date time is specified all records equal to or before the end date time will be returned.

eventStartDateTimeParam.name: eventStartDateTime
eventStartDateTimeParam.description: The specified start date time when looking up records by event date time. If no end date time is specified all records equal to or after the start date time will be returned. The event date range cannot span more than 1 day (24 hours) at a time.

eventEndDateTimeParam.name: eventEndDateTime
eventEndDateTimeParam.description: The specified end date time used when looking up records by event date time. If no start date time is specified all records equal to or before the end date time will be returned. The event date range cannot span more than 1 day (24 hours) at a time.

updatedStartDateTimeParam.name: updatedStartDateTime
updatedStartDateTimeParam.description: The specified start date time when looking up records by updated date time. If no end date time is specified all records equal to or after the start date time will be returned.

updatedEndDateTimeParam.name: updatedEndDateTime
updatedEndDateTimeParam.description: The specified end date time used when looking up records by created date time. If no start date time is specified all records equal to or before the end date time will be returned.

offsetParam.name: offset
offsetParam.description: The number of records to offset for pagination.

limitParam.name: limit
limitParam.description: The number of records to return per request for pagination (Min = 1, Max =500)

NotFound.description: The specified resource was not found

Conflict.description: The specified resource is in a conflicted state.

TooManyRequests.description: The specified resource is in a conflicted state.

value.message: Access point ID was not specified in request.
The request requires user authentication or, if the request included authorization credentials, authorization has been refused for those credentials.
The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. The server cannot fulfill the request because you do not have permission to access this resource and/or perform this action.
The user group already has a list of users.
Rate Limit Reached. Check headers for additional information.
You should never receive this error because our clever coders catch them all  but if you are unlucky enough to get one, please report it to us via email: support@isonas.com.

updatedTime.description: The time the access point was last updated.

state:

state:

 * `lockdown` Set the specified access point to lockdown.
 * `schedule` Set the specified access point to schedule.

latchInterval.description: The length of the latch interval in seconds.

id.description: The unique ID of the history event.

accesspointId.description: The ID of the access point where the history event occurred.

accesspointName.description: The access point name where history event occurred.

eventType.description: The type of event that occurred at the access point.

eventDescription.description: The description of the type of event that occurred at the access point.

eventTime.description: The time that the event occurred.

credentialDisplayValue.description: The credential value that caused the history event.

userId.description: The ID of the user that triggered the history event.

displayName.example: User last Name, User First Name

createdTime.description: The time the history event was created.

name.description: The name of the user group. Names must be unique.

description.description: The description of the user group.

rawValue.description: The raw value of the credential.

displayValue.description: The display value of the credential.

userId.description: The unique ID of the user that the credential belongs to. You cannot change the userId once it has been set.  If the userID was set incorrectly you must disable the credential and create a new one with the correct userID.

entryLimitEnabled.description: Determines if the credential has a set number of times that it can be used before it is disabled.

entryLimit.description: Determines the number of times the credential can be used for entry.

timeLimitEnabled.description: Determines if the credential has a time limit associated.

limitEndDate.description: The time that represents when the credential will stop being enabled.

isDisabled.description: Determines whether the credential is enabled or disabled.

disableReason.description: The explanation if the credential was programmatically disabled.

isMaster.description: Determines whether the credential is a master badge.

isToggle.description: Determines whether the credential is a toggle badge.

isTwoFactorCredential.description: Determines whether the credential has two factor enabled.

twoFactorPIN.description: This field is required if twoFactorCredential is true. The value must be 4-9 digits long.
